subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: The Nike Swoosh: $35 That Built an Empire
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Nike Swoosh: $35 That Built an Empire.

hook.text: In 1971, a college student was paid $35 to design a logo. It became worth billions.

buildup.text: Carolyn Davidson designed the swoosh for Phil Knight's fledgling shoe company.

discovery.text: The swoosh represents the wing of Nike, the Greek goddess of victory. It implies motion and speed.

twist.text: Knight told Davidson, 'I don't love it, but maybe it'll grow on me.' It grew on the entire world.

climax.text: In 1983, Knight gave Davidson 500 shares of Nike stock and a diamond ring as belated thanks.

punchline.text: The most iconic logo in sports was the client's second choice.

quiz.question: How much was Carolyn Davidson originally paid for the Nike swoosh?
